Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Belittle \Be*lit"tle\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Belittled}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Belittling}.] To make little or less in a moral sense; to speak of in a depreciatory or contemptuous way. --T. Jefferson. [1913 Webster]

belittle v 1: belittle; "Don't belittle his influence" [syn: {minimize}, {denigrate}, {derogate}] 2: express a negative opinion of; "She disparaged her student's efforts" [syn: {disparage}, {pick at}] [ant: {flatter}] 3: lessen the authority, dignity, or reputation of; "don't belittle your colleagues" [syn: {diminish}]
